transcript:
here's three ways your current
relationship can be affected by your
childhood number one if your parents
were highly critical of you growing up
you may now feel intolerant of anything
less than perfect so as an adult you
can't stop being critical of yourself or
the person you're in a relationship with
and number two if repairing conflict in
a healthy way was never modeled to you
growing up then it's possible that you
have no idea how to do it as an adult so
when conflict happens you may just not
acknowledge it as if nothing's happened
and that can lead to resentment over
time when things don't get resolved and
number three if growing up your home was
chaotic and unpredictable it can be
difficult to calm your threat response
as an adult so you may feel the need to
hide away control your surroundings and
keep other people at arm's length you
might become exclusively reliant on your
partner the one person that you
associate with safety which in itself
can put a strain on your relationship
